section1.title: Stone Keep
section1.problem: Our task was to create a video game using game design concepts we learned in class using any platform.
section1.solution: We picked the Unity game engine and created a 2D platformer game called Stone Keep with multiple usable characters with unique movement and fighting mechanics.

section2.summary: This page is a summary of my Game Design project for Game Design course at the University of Calgary, it's a 2D platformer called Stone Keep. To learn more, please refer to the Game Design Document.
section2.designRemarks: We have used visually appealing colours and characters catering to the story and setting of the game.
lessonsLearned: Creating complex AI and animations can be challenging when you've never used Unity or C# before while being in a group of two developers.
Level design can be difficult to balance with the game mechanics.

More time allocation for this project would've been more beneficial but not necessary because we were marked on our concept, game design documentation, assets and complexity as well and not solely on implementation.
section2.nextSteps: Creating more levels, integrating character mechanics more into these levels would be lovely but the setback we'd like to fix is the lack of player animations and addition of aerial enemy AIs.
